Yunhai Xiang

Home Research Miscellaneous

Hello! My name is Yunhai Xiang (in Chinese: 项云海, pronounced as “yee-o-en-hi si-ang”), and I also go by Daniel informally. My pronouns are he/him. I am a graduate student in pure math at Western University. I can be reached via email. I run a math blog called The Singularity. My research interests primarily lie in algebraic geometry. For more details, see my Research page.

Outside math, I’m very curious, but not very knowledgable, about physics and (analytic) philosophy. I also dabble in close-up magic, which is a hobby I’ve had since I was 10 years old. In my free time, I enjoy reading, music, anime, films, video games, and strategy games. See more in Miscellaneous.
